Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Latarcin 2a (Latarcin-2a, Ltc2a, Ltc 2a, Lys-rich; BBMm; natural AMPs; spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against Gram- E. coli DH5alpha, E. coli DH1 (MIC 0.5-0.7 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 6.7 uM), Gram+ A. globiformis, B. subtilis (MIC 0.4-0.7 uM), yeasts P. pastoris (MIC 6.7 uM), S. cerevisiae (MIC 54 uM).  A helix-hinge-helix motif (helix 3-9 and helix 13-21) was found in the presence of SDS micelles (Biochemistry 45: 10759-10767, 2006).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Toxicity: Rabbit erythrocytes (20% lysis): 6 uM, hemolytic.  Updated 2/2014; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Kozlov SA, Vassilevski AA, Feofanov AV, Surovoy AY, Karpunin DV, Grishin EV.2006
Literature Information.Title: Latarcins, antimicrobial and cytolytic peptides from the venom of the spider Lachesana tarabaevi (Zodariidae) that exemplify biomolecular diversity.
